review: And that's always good. Other than a bit of lag when scrolling, I have no complaints. Very nice to be able to control it from my laptop. Operation would probably be smoother if my computer was more powerful(It's 5 years old.)

review: If you can view a video or audio in the Chrome Browser, it can be wirelessly cast to your HDTV!  Amazing yet simple device.  Be aware though that what is not clearly shown is it does require its own power source, either a USB connection (which some older HDTV's do not have) or an AC outlet.  They give you all of the wires, just make sure you have a place on your TV or behind the TV to plug this in or you'll have a wire running across the room to connect to the nearest free outlet.
author: John T

review: Does NOT support Amazon Instant Video. Only has 13 apps available, compared to 750+ on Roku. Returning Chromecast for the far superior Roku.
